publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4290 Stuart McMillan: RNIB Work Focus Success—That the Parliament congratulates the RNIB on the success of the first year of the Work Focus pilot, started in June 2008; notes that the pilot is running in four areas to evaluate the best methods of practice in supporting blind and visually impaired people to access employment opportunities; further notes that unemployment levels among people with sight loss have remained at a high of 75% to 80% over the last 15 years with no significant reduction; commends the RNIB and Grampian Society for the Blind on their work to date on assisting people with visual impairment to gain employment; appreciates the benefits of gainful employment to an individual’s mental and physical wellbeing, making it even more important for visually impaired individuals to have the support necessary to enhance their employability; also notes the work being done by RNIB in this project to encourage employers to consider employing visually impaired individuals, and wishes the pilot well in the final year and for future success in similar projects. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson*, Nanette Milne*, Ross Finnie*, Liam McArthur*, Bill Kidd*, Mike Pringle*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Bob Doris*, Bill Wilson*
S3M-4290 RNIB Work Focus Success (lodged on 2 June 2009) Maureen Watt*, Jackson Carlaw*, Jamie Hepburn*, Robert Brown*
S3M-4290 RNIB Work Focus Success (lodged on 2 June 2009) Lewis Macdonald*
